title: IRS Fails at the Basics but Wants New Powers
sub_head: Improvement will require picking up the telephone and opening the mail.
body:
Your editorial “The IRS and Your Bank Account” (Oct. 5) raises the specter of government snooping through every bank account with at least $600 in transactions (now $10,000). If the IRS truly wanted to increase receipts, it should start by cashing the checks it receives.
Shortly after my mother passed away in January 2020, the first “stimulus” check was deposited in her bank account. After some diligent searching on the IRS’s nonuser-friendly website, I was able to find a way to return it. I did so, with a cover letter. As of today, many months later, the check has not been cashed. I guess when Congress gives the IRS its $80 billion, it will hire someone who knows how to fill out a deposit slip.
